function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Contagious spread of psychological effects such as depression, stress, anger, anxiety, and insomnia due to quarantine and covid-19 infection.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 epidemic on mental health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Psychological impact of quarantine related to covid-19 infection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid spread of covid-19 due to unrestricted social activities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Psychological impact of covid-19 outbreak on mental health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Monitoring environmental and climatic precursors of disease outbreaks","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Monitoring environmental and socioeconomic drivers of disease","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dengue importation driven by international air traffic","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Importation of dengue from dengue-affected areas through air travel","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relationship between air travel volume and imported dengue cases","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Seasonal variation in the rate of imported dengue cases","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of aedes mosquitoes in europe","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"International travel and transmission of denv","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical local transmission events","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of environmental monitoring in public health surveillance systems","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dengue dispersal through air traffic","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on external data sources for wnf case data and temperature anomalies may introduce inaccuracies and inconsistencies.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overreliance on temperature anomalies and environmental variables may overlook other important risk factors for wnv transmission.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of human and behavioral factors in wnv transmission risk assessment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Elevated temperature accelerating viral replication and transmission of wnv","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation between temperature deviations and wnf cases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Suitable environmental conditions for malaria transmission, including warmer temperatures, low elevation, and intensive agriculture","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Biological and environmental drivers of west nile virus wnv transmission, including bird and vector population densities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuing transmission of p. vivax by indigenous vectors in areas with permissive environmental and climatic conditions","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of cases with travel history from the analysis","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on geo-referenced environmental and climatic information for spatial modeling","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Autochthonous transmission of malaria","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Continued importation of malaria cases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dissemination of results to various stakeholders","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant time lags in traditional surveillance methods for health endpoints","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Geographic shift in infectious diseases leading to expansion of disease burden into new areas","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proactive approach to deal with drivers of infectious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of pathogen surveillance in the blood supply","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emerging vbd threats due to environmental/climate change, travel, and socio-economic factors","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urbanization, urban sprawl, and high population densities are associated with vector-borne disease vbd emergence.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Habitat encroachment and destruction lead to displacement of wild animals, affecting exposure patterns to infectious pathogens.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social and demographic changes, including demographic shifts and social inequality, lead to disproportionate vulnerability to infectious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of blood products from donors infected with known or unknown pathogens represents a significant threat to the blood supply and public health.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Globalization and environmental change contribute to the spread of vector-borne diseases vbd","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Approximately 60% of human pathogens are estimated to be of zoonotic origin","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Land-use can indirectly determine the spread of zoonotic diseases through exposure pathways in different urban, sub-urban, and rural settings","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different effects of methods on different types of buildings could lead to inconsistent control of disease transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of building type in the effectiveness of prevention methods","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concentration of participants from high-risk regions in the study","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unequal variances between buildings due to method type","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficiency of type 3 methods in low and medium-risk buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interaction effect of method and structure is not significant","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sphericity test not meeting significance level","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorrect interpretation of test results for effects within the subjects","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Different coping methods may have varying effects in different types of buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"}]}
